text: <a href="../2-Corinthians-5-1/" title="2 Corinthians 5:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 For we know that if our earthly house of *this* tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-2/" title="2 Corinthians 5:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:
<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-3/" title="2 Corinthians 5:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-4/" title="2 Corinthians 5:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 For we that are in *this* tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-5/" title="2 Corinthians 5:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing *is* God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-6/" title="2 Corinthians 5:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Therefore *we are* always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:
<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-7/" title="2 Corinthians 5:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-8/" title="2 Corinthians 5:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 We are confident, *I say*, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-9/" title="2 Corinthians 5:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-10/" title="2 Corinthians 5:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things *done* in *his* body, according to that he hath done, whether *it be* good or bad.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-11/" title="2 Corinthians 5:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-12/" title="2 Corinthians 5:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to *answer* them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-13/" title="2 Corinthians 5:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 For whether we be beside ourselves, *it is* to God: or whether we be sober, *it is* for your cause.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-14/" title="2 Corinthians 5:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-15/" title="2 Corinthians 5:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And *that* he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-16/" title="2 Corinthians 5:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we *him* no more.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-17/" title="2 Corinthians 5:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Therefore if any man *be* in Christ, *he is* a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-18/" title="2 Corinthians 5:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And all things *are* of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-19/" title="2 Corinthians 5:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-20/" title="2 Corinthians 5:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech *you* by us: we pray *you* in Christ's stead, be ye reconciled to God.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-5-21/" title="2 Corinthians 5:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 For he hath made him *to be* sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.
